heading: Diablo 4 Open Beta Details
content: The Diablo 4 Developer Live Stream has come, and we have learned a lot of . This update was given to us by (Game Director), (Lead Systems Designer), (Lead World Designer) and (Community Lead). We have finally learned the minimum and recommend PC specifications. It was also noted that Ray tracing will be supported after release and wide screens and ultrawide screens are supported up to a resolution of 3:1. Settings to run the Diablo IV Open Beta at 1080p native resolution / 720p render resolution, low graphics settings, 30 fps. There are three rewards for playing the Beta and they all transfer to the live game on launch. Armor is the most basic way we defend ourselves from taking damage in Diablo 4. During the course of the blog, we learned some new details on how Armor works. The team showed us graphs to get a general idea of what to expect in the game. Trading is a hotly debated topic. The developers are going back and forth deciding what is good for the players, but for the overall health of the game, too. Several remarks were stated on the matter during the livestream: For now, trade will be simple. The future may bring different rulesets, expanding what is possible. will be blasting Diablo 4 and we hope to see you there! If you haven't already, head over to our and select the D4 role in to stay up to date with our content development and check out our first . Sanctuary here we come!
